question:
Which committee is responsible for reviewing promotion and tenure cases?
A. Advisory Committee on Promotion and Tenure
B. Committee on Student Discipline
C. Committee on Undergraduate Curriculum
D. Committee on Nominations and Elections

How many tenured faculty members are elected to the Committee on Student Discipline?
A. 3
B. 6
C. 9
D. 12

Which committee includes three undergraduate student representatives?
A. Graduate Curriculum Committee
B. Committee on Undergraduate Curriculum
C. Committee on Policy and Planning
D. Committee on Student Discipline

Who elects the faculty members of the CAS standing committees?
A. CAS Dean
B. Department chairs
C. CAS faculty
D. CAS Senate

What is the typical term length for CAS standing committee members?
A. 1 year
B. 2 years
C. 3 years
D. 5 years

Which committee provides advice on curriculum and graduation requirements?
A. Committee on Student Discipline
B. Committee on Undergraduate Curriculum
C. Advisory Committee on Promotion and Tenure
D. Committee on Grievance

What is the main function of the Committee on Student Discipline?
A. Handle financial aid appeals
B. Review academic misconduct
C. Propose new majors
D. Approve study abroad requests

Who appoints members to the Committee on Grievance?
A. Faculty vote
B. Dean
C. Nominations Committee
D. Department Chairs

The Committee on Nominations and Elections is responsible for:
A. Choosing commencement speakers
B. Administering faculty election processes
C. Selecting student orientation leaders
D. Assigning teaching loads

Which committee advises the Dean on long-term planning and budgeting?
A. Committee on Grievance
B. Committee on Policy and Planning
C. Committee on Student Discipline
D. Undergraduate Curriculum Committee

Which committee does not permit department chairs as members?
A. Committee on Nominations and Elections
B. Committee on Policy and Planning
C. Committee on Grievance
D. Committee on Student Discipline

What is a primary concern of the Committee on Policy and Planning?
A. Course scheduling
B. Long-term strategic issues
C. Managing classroom disputes
D. Running faculty elections

How many standing committees explicitly include student members?
A. One
B. Two
C. Three
D. Four

What level of faculty rank is required to serve on the Promotion and Tenure Committee?
A. Any faculty
B. Non-tenure-track faculty
C. Tenured full professors only
D. Visiting faculty

How are committee chairpersons chosen?
A. Appointed by the Dean
B. Elected by the committee members
C. Rotated by department seniority
D. Selected by Faculty Senate

Which committee may handle issues regarding dismissal of students for misconduct?
A. Committee on Grievance
B. Committee on Undergraduate Curriculum
C. Committee on Student Discipline
D. Committee on Promotion and Tenure

Which committee ensures representation across departments and ranks?
A. Nominations and Elections
B. Policy and Planning
C. Grievance
D. Undergraduate Curriculum

Student representatives in the Undergraduate Curriculum Committee are:
A. Selected by lottery
B. Elected by student government
C. Appointed by the Dean
D. Nominated by faculty

Faculty elections for committee membership are held:
A. Every semester
B. Annually in spring
C. Only in fall semesters
D. On a rolling basis

How many standing committees are listed in the standing committees document?
A. 7
B. 9
C. 11
D. 13
